alert.note: Alert for Southeast Suffolk; Southern Nassau; Southwest Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued January 11 at 5:15PM EST until January 13 at 6:00PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO 6 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...2 1/2 to 3 feet of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...Southwest Suffolk, Southeast Suffolk and Southern Nassau Counties. * WHEN...From 7 AM to 6 PM EST Saturday. * COASTAL FLOOD IMPACTS...Widespread moderate to major flooding of vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline Saturday morning, with 2 1/2 ft to 3 ft of inundation above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas. This will result in extensive road closures and flooding of low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns and first floors and basements of homes/businesses near the waterfront. Vehicles parked in vulnerable areas near the waterfront will likely become flooded and/or submerged. Flooding will likely also extend inland from typical flood prone areas along the tidal rivers and bays, causing flooding in some areas that typically don`t see flooding. * SHORELINE IMPACTS...Large breaking waves of 12 to 16 feet along the oceanfront will likely result in widespread dune erosion and damage to dune structures. Scattered overwashes are likely, resulting in some flooding of roadways and vulnerable structures behind protective dunes. Isolated breaches or inundation of the barrier island is possible where dune structures have been severely compromised by previous storms. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Peak surge of 3 to 4 ft will be likely between times of high tide Friday evening and Saturday morning. Tidal piling will likely inhibit the recession of water before the Saturday AM high tide, which will likely cause major flooding (3 ft above ground) for areas from Freeport to Mastic and along the bay side of Fire island. West to southwest gale winds will likely keep waters elevated well into Saturday afternoon, along with 2 to 3 ft of wave action along the eastern great South Bay. Resident in coastal communities in this area should prepare for the potential of major coastal flooding (3ft of inundation above ground). This will be refined over the next 24 to 36 hours. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. GREAT SOUTH BAY AT LINDENHURST NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 3.1 FT, MODERATE 3.6 FT, MAJOR 4.1 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.5 FT, MODERATE 2.0 FT, MAJOR 2.5 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 11/10 PM 1.2/ 1.7 -0.5/ 0.0 0.0/ 0.5 0-1 NONE 12/11 AM 1.8/ 2.2 0.2/ 0.7 0.2/ 0.8 0 NONE 13/12 AM 3.0/ 3.5 1.4/ 1.9 1.9/ 2.3 1-3 MINOR 13/11 AM 3.7/ 4.2 2.2/ 2.7 2.2/ 2.7 2-3 MAJOR 13/11 PM 1.8/ 2.2 0.2/ 0.7 0.6/ 1.1 2 NONE 14/12 PM 2.1/ 2.6 0.5/ 1.0 0.6/ 1.1 2 NONE GREAT SOUTH BAY AT WEST SAYVILLE NY MLLW CATEGORIES - info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
